intro: Tovomita pentapetala, commonly known as the five-petaled tovomita, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of western Africa. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant, white to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The fruit is a fleshy, berry-like structure that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
